committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Courts, Civil Liberties, and the Administration of Justice

official_title: A bill to amend title 17 of the United States Code with respect to the fees of the Copyright Office, and for other purposes.

summary.text: (Conference report filed in House, H. Rept. 97-930) Amends the copyright law to require that registration fees be paid to the Copyright Office when the registration application is filed. Limits refunds of such fees to mistakes or excess payments. Exempts nonprofit veterans' organizations and nonprofit fraternal organizations from the requirement that nondramatic literary or musical performance royalties be paid to copyright holders when the performances are for charitable fund raising purposes. Upgrades the position of Commissioner of Patents and Trademarks to that of Assistant Secretary of Commerce.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 17 of the United States Code with respect to the fees of the Copyright Office, and for other purposes.
